alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; Greene; Madison; Orange; Southern Fauquier (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 22 at 7:29PM EST until December 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of DC, Maryland and Virginia, including the following areas: District of Columbia. In Maryland, Anne Arundel, Calvert, Cecil, Central and Southeast Howard, Central and Southeast Montgomery, Charles, Prince Georges, Southeast Harford, Southern Baltimore and St. Marys. In Virginia, Albemarle, Arlington/Falls Church/Alexandria, Culpeper, Fairfax, Greene, King George, Madison, Nelson, Orange, Prince William/Manassas/Manassas Park, Southern Fauquier, Spotsylvania and Stafford. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to locally heavy rainfall will gradually taper off this evening. Rainfall totals of one to three inches are expected. This may lead to isolated instances of flooding, especially in urban and poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Albemarle; Greene; Madison; Orange; Southern Fauquier
